availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles L. Thomasson (Louisville, KY, attorney and major 5th Ky. Vol. Inf.)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Poindexter Thomasson and Charlotte Thomasson. Graduate of the University of Louisville Law School in 1848. Attorney in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain and major from September 9, 1861. Killed at the Battle of Chickamauga on September 19, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 232A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 174.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 684-5.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0200.
Catalogue of the Officers and Students in the Law Department of the University of Louisville, Session of 1859-'60 (Louisville: Hull & Brother, Printers, 1860), 10.
